topic.title: Host docs on ZeroNet ?
topic.body:
[is it *okay* to put docs that are ~200MB+ on zeronet](/1JkFUDhPb4CFcyL8viq7B8UgLePPx3mBgH/files/hs/base-4.8.0.0/doc-index-All.html)?

I see that [zeronet Docs](/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/) being hosted like this. This way devs who need to refer docs get to have the offline version and also act as a seeder to others needing it.

1_1FQzw6BBWb8DqSgT3uMsMpcWu3uz48bEDX.body:
> [plavojabuka](#comment_2_158KZsYQsNp4j4kiPrkqXvTPRewEXeP24W): the creator of that site put up the private key so that the community could publish whatever they wanted to that site.   if you look at  data/1FqhRosMouo37Z8iDpLTEPvfznBq1b4N4w/index.html you can see that someone just edited the html to be that pic which can be found with a quick google search.tl:dr the fbi didnt seize anything its just a pic.

did the creator deliberately made the private key public?

1_1Hz5zjZ6UfmEckdzBWxMFyYWMvBix3ABTZ.body:
> [ks](#comment_49_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): You can put anything you like on Zeronet. If other people like it, too, they will seed your stuff.

will every seeder be downloading whole 200MB+ files (first time) ?

> [ks](#comment_50_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): Zeronet will attempt to fetch the whole site with all its files, so the answer is yes.

I guess if enough seeders arise then site owner can make all files "optional" which will then let visitors download only the files they need (and seed only such files?)

4762_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body:
> [hololense](#comment_1_1PRtPMsAohGekTGBAqKEZG1V8ZPX4iY2gW): I would have read it, if it where on Zeronet

+1
